intro: Glochidion mandakamdevi, commonly known as the Kanyakumari glochidion, is a small evergreen shrub native to the southern regions of India. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers followed by greenish fruits that turn red when mature. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
